item.name: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
Antike
item.comment: Simple and sturdy. Has some drawbacks; the rich get richer, fall behind and you lose, all against the leader -syndrome - but very clever mechanisms otherwise.

item.name: Attack!
item.comment: Simply the best "empire-game" and WWII-game on a strategic scale, yet. Smooth, intuitive rules, great mini-games. Play with expansion to add versity, and threaded turns to bring down downtime to a minimum. You don¬¥t won¬¥t to play any other conquer the world-game after playing this. Downsides are perhaps that the game can be a bit chaotic due to card play and it is possible to expand quickly, but it is intended as a fun game, not a history lesson. Eagle Games best yet!

item.name: Augustus
item.comment: Not much of a game here, but sort of quick fun with the right crowd and time. Expansion with better options for players, please.

item.name: Black Fleet
item.comment: Good fun. More strategic and varied than I thought. All players liked it - we played twice. Very different games both times. Strong theme to boot.

item.name: Blood Feud in New York
item.comment:
A nice addition to the A&A-clones of games. A bit basic, but still enough options to keep it interesting. An expansion perhaps? It drips with theme and the rules are well written, as an experienced player of these kind of games I had no trouble at all explaining the rules after 1 reading. Extremly high production values.
It will get table time and probably replace some older similiar games (Shogun, Risk, A&A (already discarded due to Attack!).

item.name: A Brief History of the World
Buck Rogers: Battle for the 25th Century Game
Colt Express
item.comment: Great fun!

item.name: Conquest of the Empire
item.comment: A great political-war-civ-game that really captures the feel of the late Roman empire. And its both very playable and enjoyable too! Perhaps THE game on the subject? Or will nostalgic grognards moan for SPQR, Imperium Romanum, et al?

item.name: Cyclades
item.comment: Great game, with excellent components. Clever bidding mechanism and civ lite theme that really works.

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Escape: The Curse of the Temple ‚Äì Doomed
Escape: The Curse of the Temple ‚Äì The Pit
The Extraordinary Adventures of Baron Munchausen
The Extraordinary Adventures of Baron Munchausen
A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition)
A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition) ‚Äì A Dance with Dragons
The Great Heartland Hauling Co.: Badlands
I Hate Zombies
item.comment: Good fun. Tried the PnP set with 6 players at the local pub. Worked very fine.

item.name: I Hate Zombies: We Hate Zombies Too
In the Year of the Dragon
Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King
Kardinal & K√∂nig
item.comment: Dry, but elegant mechanisms. Easy to introduce to non-gamers and almost everyone want to have a go again, which is a good grade in my book.

item.name: Mare Nostrum
item.comment: A close to perfect light-weight empire game that gets better with each and every play. Some minor balance issues has been handled and the game now truly shines.

item.name: Mare Nostrum: Mythology Expansion
item.comment: Great addition to an already great game.

item.name: MarraCash
item.comment: Great fun light game with strategic options.

item.name: Mutant Chronicles: Siege of the Citadel
Okko, Yakuza Hazu Akai
item.comment: Great expansion!

item.name: Okko: Era of the Asagiri
item.comment: Great miniature lite game, with well thought-out rules and features. Intuitive game play and a theme that works very well. The graphics are excellent. You feel like you are part of a samurai show down. Kudos.

item.name: Once Upon a Time: Dark Tales
Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game
Origin
item.comment: Really loved this one. Amazing "naive" art, gorgeous pieces and surprisningly easy rules. Thematic yet light abstract with hidden depth. You really feel you are evolving mankind and discovering the world.

item.name: Panic Station: Survival Kit Mini Expansion
Quantum
item.comment:
Good stuff! Simple on the surface (but not really), interesting choices, interactive, good interaction.
Me like.

item.name: Quantum: The Void
item.comment: Good for varity, but it slows down the game a little bit.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy
item.comment: Do not understand the fuzz - bland card play and almost no interaction.

item.name: Raja: Palastbau in Indien
item.originalname: Maharaja: The Game of Palace Building in India

item.name: Rise and Decline of the Third Reich
Risk: The Lord of the Rings Trilogy Edition
Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
Sheriff of Nottingham: Royal Summons Promo Card
Sheriff of Nottingham: Royal Summons Promo Card
Sheriff of Nottingham: Royal Summons Promo Card
Shipwrights of the North Sea
item.comment: Very good game and thematic at the same time. Hard choices with the card selection (much better than 7 Wonders)- all liked it.

item.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Seefahrer Erweiterung
Sons of Anarchy: Men of Mayhem
Spartacus: A Game of Blood & Treachery
Spartacus: The Serpents and the Wolf Expansion Set
Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Kickstarter Deluxe Content
Toc Toc Woodman: Golden Axe Expansion
Toc Toc Woodman: Golden Core and Bark Promo
Torres
item.comment: A great, simple strategic game. A bit dry but with lots of options. You want to do lots of actions but must choose carefully. There is always something going on, to keep close watch over, and it is fairly quick too. A keeper.

item.name: Wars of the Roses: Lancaster vs. York
